1.text: Wipe down your skillet with oil to get rid of lightly stuck food.
1.vid: /e/e1/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4

2.text: Use baking soda or salt to scrub away burnt food.
2.vid: /7/73/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Lift away more difficult foods by boiling some water in your skillet.
3.vid: /f/fe/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4

4.text: Dry your skillet in the oven.
4.vid: /c/c4/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4

5.text: Apply a coat of oil to your skillet once you've cleaned it.
5.vid: /c/cf/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4

6.text: Use steel wool to scrub your skillet clean.
6.vid: /9/95/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4

7.text: Clean the skillet with soap and hot water.

8.text: Put the skillet in a hot oven to dry it.
8.vid: /8/88/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4

9.vid: /c/cc/Clean a Burnt Cast Iron Skillet Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4

10.text: Put the skillet in your oven at around 500 °F (260 °C) for 1 hour.

11.text: Let the pan cool and repeat the seasoning process.
